We have a stick of length 1 and it breaks. What is the probability that the broken pieces form a triangle ?



::: {.callout-tip collapse="true"}
## ðŸ’¡ Hint

Parametrize the problem with the length of the broken pieces and compute the partial area corresponding to a triangle.
:::

::: {.callout-tip collapse="true"}
## ðŸ’¡ Solution

Let $x$ be the length of the first piece and $y$ the second piece (thus the final length is $1-x-y$)

Since all length are positive, the possible region is $$\begin{cases} x \ge 0 \\ y \ge 0 \\ y \le 1 -x \end{cases}.$$

The broken pieces form a triangle if and only if all length are lower than the sum of the other sides. Thus we have 
$$\begin{cases} x \le y + 1 -x -y \\  y \le y + 1 -x -y \\ 1 -x - y \le x + y  \end{cases} \sim \begin{cases} x \le 1/2 \\  y \le 1/2 \\ y \ge 1/2 -x   \end{cases}.$$

We can plot the regions and we find $\boxed{\mathbb{P}(\text{Triangle}) = \frac{A_{tri}}{A_{tot}}=\frac{1/8}{1/2}=1/4.}$

```{python}
#| echo: false

import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

n = 1000
x = np.linspace(0, 1, n)
y = np.linspace(0, 1, n)
X, Y = np.meshgrid(x, y)

possible = (X >= 0) & (Y >= 0) & (X + Y <= 1)

triangle = (
    possible &
    (X <= 0.5) &
    (Y <= 0.5) &
    (X + Y >= 0.5)
)

plt.figure(figsize=(6,6))
plt.contourf(X, Y, possible, levels=[0.5,1], colors=["red"], alpha=0.5)
plt.contourf(X, Y, triangle, levels=[0.5,1], colors=["blue"], alpha=0.8)

plt.xlabel("x")
plt.ylabel("y")
plt.title("Triangle Region for Pieces x, y, 1-x-y")
plt.xlim(0,1)
plt.ylim(0,1)
plt.gca().set_aspect('equal')
plt.show()
```
:::
